ygData.subject: Re: [EverQuest] Hangouts for teens
ygData.msgSnippet: In PoP a bard is the puller of choice. Who cares if lull fails, if we can fade. Faster then trying to split the pull. If you are pulling aggro off of a tank,
ygData.messageBody:
In PoP a bard is the puller of choice. Who cares if lull fails, if we can fade. Faster then trying to split the pull. If you are pulling aggro off of a tank, well, you are doing it wrong. It is not thier job to keep aggro off you, but your job to not pull it off the tank. Try FD every 30 seconds. Then you can do max damage.
 
Awulfie A'Mused
----- Original Message -----
From: Kent King
To: EverQuest@yahoogroups.com
Sent: Sunday, December 21, 2003 11:48 AM
Subject: RE: [EverQuest] Hangouts for teens

LOL, so so true!  As a monk (my main) my trouble right
now is that mamby pamby tanks can't hold aggros when
I'm hitting the mobs.  The art of monkish melee is not
to do maximal damage, but to do just a little less
damage than the tank I'm paired with.  If I'm paired
with a bard or a pally then forget it.  I might as
well hold a fishing pole in my primary hand. 

You don't know how many times the tank I'm working
with has over-aggroed and gotten the group killed.
You also don't know how many times I've seen bards
having to kite their adds and pull in even more
because harmony fails :)

Let a monk pull onsies... lots safer for the group
that way.

Quwi Changkane Fenin Ro Grandmaster  

--- "Steven R. Hulse" <steveh@...> wrote:
> Pull several, that's what the tanks are for, to take
> the beating. Unless of
> course they are namby-pamby tanks! LOL
>
> > -----Original Message-----
> > Message: 2
> >    Date: Sat, 20 Dec 2003 10:56:24 -0800 (PST)
> >    From: Kent King <propellerheadus@...>
> > Subject: RE: Hangouts for teens
> >
> > That's why you need a monk :)  We can pull one at
> a
> > time if the tanks would let us.
> >
>
>
